history.content: We strongly discourage students from taking 61B and 61C together. You still have a lot of time to complete your degree.

As a counterpoint to the instructional answer (which is correct in 90% of cases), I have met a couple people who have taken data structures in some other form before and they are easily able to get A+ while breezin’ through projects. For me (who had coding experience) projects were easy as well. If you don’t have either of these, you’re going to be overwhelmed.

children.subject: Fair warning from someone who took 61B and 61C together: there will be some weekends where project deadlines for both 61B and 61C align, and you will just have to cram through those periods of high workload.

Thanks for the responses! I wasn't super worried about 61B, since I have prior programming experience and know most of what's on the syllabus. I was more concerned about the time commitment of the three courses put together, as well as if 61C draws from 61B content. 

I also want to graduate early and take plenty of courses which 61C is a prereq for (and the 61C content seems very interesting to me as well), which is why I'm thinking of doing these 3 together.

I mean there’s no real prereq stuff from 61b for 61c that should be a pain. However, your classes all seem to project based. Near the end of the semester you’re going to be building a voice control robot, designing a cpu, and implementing google maps all the same time. Each of these things is kinda fun but doing them all at the same time makes you actually learn less than you would doing them separately. If you want to take more classes, take a more pset like class instead of 61c.

history.content: Would it be feasible to do these 3 courses together while understanding the material/getting good grades?
history.subject: CS61B + CS61C + EE16B workload?
